title: Untitled
text:
Brian Heydon, a 96-year-old former lawyer, has opened his first solo art exhibition in Castlemaine, 15 years after picking up a paintbrush. He began painting in his 80s, inspired by French impressionists like Cézanne.

After two years of still-life training, Heydon found joy in expressing memories through oil painting. Now, with encouragement from his teacher, he’s proudly displaying his work for the first time.

Heydon said: “The sun is shining, God’s in heaven — all is right in the world.”
